He ordered an immediate retreat to avoid further casualties
He commanded the Ansaar to form a defensive circle around him
He sent messengers to Madinah requesting reinforcements

quizQuestions.explanation: When surrounded at Uhud with only seven Ansaar and two men from Quraysh, the Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Who will repel them from us and Paradise will be his, or he will be my companion in Paradise?' The Ansaar went forward one after another until all seven were martyred.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, what is the ruling on a lawyer who defends falsehood knowingly while regarding it as permissible and relying on man-made laws?

options.text: He is a kaafir if he regards doing that as permissible or is heedless and does not care that he is going against the Quran and Sunnah
He is committing a minor sin but his income remains halal if he gives charity from it
He is excused because he is working within the legal system of his country
He is only sinful if he defends someone he knows committed murder

quizQuestions.explanation: A lawyer who defends falsehood knowingly and regards it as permissible, or is heedless and does not care that he is going against the Quran and Sunnah while following man-made laws, is considered a kaafir. Whatever he earns for doing that is haram income.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the basic principle regarding a mother in custody of her children taking from their maintenance money?

options.text: She does not have the right to take anything from it in return for taking care of them; she is entrusted with the money to dispose of it according to their best interests
She can take up to 30% of the maintenance money as compensation for her care
She has the right to take whatever she needs without restriction since she is their mother
She can only take from it if the father explicitly gives her permission

quizQuestions.explanation: The basic principle is that the mother who has custody of her children does not have the right to take anything from her children's maintenance money in return for taking care of them. She is entrusted with the money and expected to dispose of it according to what is in their best interests.
tags: Spending on those under ones responsibility

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal say when asked if a man with a Christian wife could let her go out to join in Christian festivals or go to the church?

options.text: He said no
He said she could go once per month
He said it was permissible if she asked permission first
He said it was makruh but not haram

quizQuestions.explanation: When Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal was asked about a man who had a Christian wife and whether he could let her go out to join in Christian festivals or go to the church, he said no. The answer explains that if scholars said the husband should stop a Christian wife from going to church, then celebrating festivals in the Muslim husband's house is even worse.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars quoted in the answer, what is the correct view regarding whether the words of Allah in the Torah, Gospel, Quran, and Zabur are created?

options.text: Nothing of the words of Allah is created; He spoke the Torah, Gospel, Quran and Zabur in a real sense, and not a single letter is created
Only the Quran is uncreated, while the previous scriptures were created by Allah
The meanings are from Allah but the words and letters were created
All divine books are created, but they contain inspired meanings from Allah

quizQuestions.explanation: The view of the early generations and leading scholars is that nothing of the words of Allah is created. He spoke the Torah, Gospel, Quran and Zabur in a real sense, and not a single letter of any of them is created. They are all the words of Allah and we do not differentiate between the Messengers or the revealed Books.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling according to Soorat al-Tawbah on someone who mocks Allah, His verses, or His Messengers, whether in earnest or in jest?

options.text: It is kufr that puts one beyond the pale of Islam, because joking about kufr is also kufr
It is a major sin if done in earnest, but a minor sin if done in jest
It is only kufr if the person intends disrespect; otherwise it requires repentance and expiation
It is haram but does not constitute kufr as long as the person still believes in Allah

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the verse in Soorat al-Tawbah (9:64-66), mocking Allah, His verses, or His Messengers is kufr whether done in earnest or in jest. Al-Qaadi Abu Bakr ibn al-'Arabi stated that joking about kufr is also kufr, and there is no difference of opinion concerning this among the ummah.

quizQuestions.questionText: Is it permissible for a group located thirty miles away from a large hall where Eid prayers are being held to organize their own Eid prayers in their mosque?

options.text: Yes, there is nothing wrong with them praying in their own city if the distance makes it difficult to join together
No, they must travel to join the larger gathering regardless of the difficulty
They can only hold separate prayers if they have more than fifty people
They need permission from the imam of the main hall before holding separate prayers

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the answer, if joining together will be too difficult, there is nothing wrong with the group that is thirty miles away praying in their own city, as this distance makes it difficult for them to join together. However, if they can join together, that is preferable.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on engraving Quranic verses or the Name of Allah on metals or stone according to the answer?

options.text: It is not permissible because this is not the purpose for which these verses were revealed, and there is fear of exposing them to disrespect
It is permissible if the metal or stone will be kept in a clean place
It is makruh but not haram as long as the engravings are accurate
It is recommended as a form of dhikr and beautification

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states it is not permissible to engrave ayaat from the Quran or the Name of Allah on metals or stone, because this is not the purpose for which these ayaat were revealed, and there is the fear that this would expose these ayaat and the Name of Allah to disrespect.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Ibn Mas'ud say about those who stayed away from congregational prayer?

options.text: There was a time when no one stayed away from the prayer except a hypocrite who was known for his hypocrisy or one who was sick
Those who miss congregational prayer three times become hypocrites
Only those with urgent business matters are excused from congregational prayer
Missing congregational prayer is a minor sin that requires making up the prayer later

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn Mas'ud said: 'There was a time when no one stayed away from the prayer except a hypocrite who was known for his hypocrisy or one who was sick.' This hadith is narrated by Muslim (654) and indicates that sick persons are spared the obligation to pray in congregation.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith narrated by at-Tirmidhi, what should a person say three times every morning and evening for protection?

options.text: Bismillah illadhi la yadurru ma'a ismihi shay'un fi'l-ardi wa la fi's-sama' wa huwa as-sami' al-'alim (In the Name of Allah, with whose name nothing on earth or in heaven can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing)
La hawla wa la quwwata illa billah (There is no power and no strength except with Allah)
Hasbunallahu wa ni'mal wakeel (Allah is sufficient for us and He is the best Disposer of affairs)
Allahu Akbar wa lillahil hamd (Allah is the Greatest and all praise is for Allah)

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'There is no one who says every morning and every evening Bismillah illadhi la yadurru ma'a ismihi shay'un fi'l-ardi wa la fi's-sama' wa huwa as-sami' al-'alim (In the Name of Allah, with whose name nothing on earth or in heaven can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing) three times, but nothing will harm him.' This is a sahih hadith narrated by at-Tirmidhi.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Jareer ibn 'Abdullah say about gathering with the family of the deceased and making food after burial?

options.text: We used to regard it as coming under the same heading as wailing
We used to regard it as a recommended act of charity for the deceased
We used to regard it as permissible if done within three days
We used to regard it as obligatory for close relatives only

quizQuestions.explanation: Jareer ibn 'Abdullah said: 'We used to regard gathering with the family of the deceased and making food after the burial as coming under the same heading as wailing.' This shows the Companions viewed this practice negatively and considered it similar to the prohibited act of wailing.
tags: Rulings on enjoining what is good and forbidding what is evil

quizQuestions.questionText: What two choices does the purchaser have when he discovers he was cheated in an unfair deal according to Islamic rulings?

options.text: Returning the goods or keeping them (with compensation according to some scholars)
Filing a lawsuit or accepting the transaction permanently
Demanding triple compensation or forgiving the seller completely
Keeping the goods with partial refund or selling to another party

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Islamic jurisprudence, the one who discovers unfair dealing has the choice between canceling the deal entirely (returning goods and getting back the payment) or, according to some scholars like Ibn Rajab, going ahead with the deal but receiving compensation for the price difference.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the supplication mentioned in the hadith that should be said during marital relations?

options.text: Bismillaah, Allaahumma jannibni al-Shaytaana wa jannib al-Shaytaana ma razaqtana (In the name of Allah, O Allah, keep the Shaytaan away from me and keep the Shaytaan away from that which You bestow upon us)
Allaahumma baarik lana wa baarik 'alayna (O Allah, bless us and grant us Your blessings)
Subhaanaka Allaahumma wa bihamdika (Glory be to You, O Allah, and praise be to You)
Rabbana atina fi al-dunya hasanah (Our Lord, give us good in this world)

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: 'If one of you says, when he has intercourse with his wife: Bismillaah, Allaahumma jannibni al-Shaytaana wa jannib al-Shaytaana ma razaqtana, if it is decreed that they should have a child, the Shaytaan will never harm him.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the two faults At-Tirmidhi identified in the hadith about reciting Surah Ad-Dukhan on the night before Friday?

options.text: Abu Al-Miqdam Hisham is unanimously regarded as weak, and there is a break in the chain between Al-Hasan and Abu Hurayrah
The hadith contradicts the Quran, and the narrator was known to fabricate hadiths intentionally
The text is unclear in meaning, and the chain includes an unknown narrator from Yemen
The hadith was narrated by children, and it conflicts with authentic hadiths from Bukhari

quizQuestions.explanation: At-Tirmidhi identified two specific faults: (1) Abu Al-Miqdam Hisham ibn Ziyad is regarded as da'eef (weak) by scholars unanimously, with Ibn Hibban stating he narrates fabricated reports; and (2) there is a break in the chain of narrators between Al-Hasan and Abu Hurayrah, as confirmed by Ayyub, Yunus ibn 'Ubayd and 'Ali ibn Zayd.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, where should a pilgrim stay if he cannot find room in Mina?

options.text: He should stay where the tents end, even if it is in Muzdalifah, because Allah does not burden a soul beyond its scope
He must drive around Mina all night searching for a spot among the vehicles
He should return to his hotel in Makkah and come back early morning
He must offer a sacrifice of a sheep to compensate for not staying in Mina

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated clearly: 'If a person cannot find any room in Mina, he should stay where the tents end. But if he can find room (in Mina) then he must stay there overnight.' He also said not to spend the night driving around or looking for spots on the roadside as that may put pilgrims in danger.
tags: Mawaaqeet (points from which pilgrims enter ihraam)

quizQuestions.questionText: What did 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) say about vows?

options.text: Four things are binding in every case: manumission, divorce, marriage, and vows
Vows can be retracted within three days if circumstances change
Only vows made in the mosque are binding and must be fulfilled
Vows are recommended but not obligatory to fulfill in all situations

quizQuestions.explanation: 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) stated clearly: 'Four things are binding in every case: manumission, divorce, marriage, and vows.' This emphasizes that vows, once made, cannot be retracted and must be fulfilled, placing them at the same level of seriousness as divorce and marriage.

quizQuestions.questionText: At how many points in the prayer is it proven in the Sunnah to raise the hands?

options.text: Four points: when pronouncing takbeerat al-ihram, when doing rukoo', when standing up from rukoo', and after standing up from the first tashahhud
Two points: only at the beginning of prayer and when going into rukoo'
Six points: at every takbeer throughout all the rak'ahs
Three points: at the opening takbeer, before rukoo', and in the final sitting

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states: 'So what is proven in the Sunnah with regard to raising the hands in prayer is that they should be raised at four points in the prayer: when pronouncing takbeerat al-ihram, when doing rukoo', when standing up from rukoo', and after standing up from the first tashahhud.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the two types of haraam wealth mentioned in the answer?

options.text: Wealth that is haraam in and of itself (taken without consent like theft), and wealth that is haraam because of the manner it was acquired (taken with consent for haraam actions)
Wealth from gambling and wealth from interest-based loans only
Wealth obtained through deception and wealth obtained through force
Wealth from forbidden business and wealth from prohibited employment

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly distinguishes two types: (1) Wealth haraam in and of itself - taken without consent such as stolen, seized by force, or plundered wealth. This must be returned to the owner. (2) Wealth haraam because of the manner acquired - taken with consent for haraam actions like singing fees, riba transactions, bribes, etc. This is only haraam for the one who acquired it.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, what is the father's obligation regarding his son's marriage?

options.text: Just as the father is obliged to spend on his son's food, drink, clothing and accommodation, he must also arrange his marriage if the son needs to get married
The father is only responsible for finding a suitable match but not for any financial support
The father must wait until the son can earn his own money before arranging marriage
The father's responsibility is limited to giving advice about marriage partners

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated: 'As Allah has enjoined upon your father to spend on your food, drink, clothing and accommodation, he must also arrange your marriage if you need to get married, as the scholars have said.' He emphasized that whoever is obliged to spend on a person is also obliged to keep him chaste and arrange his marriage.

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the three actions on the Day of Sacrifice for a pilgrim doing Ifraad?

options.text: Stoning Jamrat al-'Aqabah, shaving the head or cutting the hair, and tawaf al-ifaadah (plus Sa'i if not done after tawaf of arrival)
Offering sacrifice, spending night in Muzdalifah, and performing tawaf al-wida'
Stoning all three jamarat, performing two rak'ahs, and making du'aa at Mount Arafat
Drinking Zamzam water, circling the Ka'bah seven times, and shaving the entire head only

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'The actions of the Day of Sacrifice are three for the pilgrim who is doing Ifraad. They are: stoning Jamrat al-'Aqabah, shaving the head or cutting the hair, and tawaf al-ifaadah, plus Sa'i if he did not do it after the tawaf of arrival.'
tags: Sifat al-Hajj wa'l-'Umrah (Description of Hajj and 'Umrah)

quizQuestions.questionText: When is it permissible for a woman to cut her hair with bangs (fringe) across her forehead?

options.text: When it is a modern trend among women considered attractive and she appears this way for her husband and close friends
When the purpose is to resemble non-Muslim and atheist women
When she wants to imitate kaafir women's hairstyles
Only after consulting with Islamic scholars about the specific hairstyle

quizQuestions.explanation: If the haircut is not for imitating non-Muslims but is simply a modern trend among women considered attractive, a woman can adorn herself this way for her husband and appear like this in front of her close friends. However, if the purpose is to resemble kaafir and atheist women, it is haram because imitation of non-Muslims is forbidden.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith 'Each of you is a shepherd', what is emphasized about parents' responsibility in raising children?

options.text: Each parent is individually responsible for the flock they shepherd, with both the man and woman being shepherds of the household and children
Only the father is responsible as the wali (guardian) and head of the household
The mother has primary responsibility since she spends more time with the children
The responsibility can be delegated to extended family members who have more experience

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith refers to the responsibility of each parent individually, reinforcing that each of them is individually responsible. A man is the shepherd of his household and responsible for his flock, while a woman is the shepherd of her husband's house and children and responsible for her flock. This is a shared responsibility that cannot be restricted to one parent.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why does Islam permit a Muslim man to marry a Jewish or Christian woman but not a woman who only believes in one God without following a revealed religion?

options.text: The kitaabi woman believes in God, His messages in general terms, and the resurrection, making her close to Islam, and marrying her may call her and her family to Islam
Jewish and Christian women have special legal status granted by their governments
The Torah and Gospel contain more truth than other beliefs, making these women more trustworthy
Historical treaties between Muslims and People of the Book established this permission

quizQuestions.explanation: Allah knows that the kitaabi (Jewish or Christian) woman who believes in God, believes in His messages in general terms, and believes in the resurrection is close to Islam as a result. Marrying her will, in most cases, call her and her family to Islam and encourage her to enter Islam, in contrast to a woman who does not believe in God, the Prophets, or the resurrection. This is the wisdom behind this ruling.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Muhammad ibn Saalih al-'Uthaymeen, what can a woman stipulate as a condition of her marriage regarding her studies?

options.text: She can stipulate that she be able to continue studying until her studies are complete
She must abandon her studies immediately upon marriage as it conflicts with household duties
She can only study religious subjects after marriage, not secular education
She needs her guardian's renewed permission for each academic year after marriage

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh al-'Uthaymeen advised guardians to let women complete their studies, stating that marriage and study can be combined. A woman may stipulate as a condition of her marriage that she be able to continue studying until her studies are complete. Marriage is important, but it does not mean that a woman cannot study.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on bribery given to obtain a job based on a competitive test, according to the answer?

options.text: It is haram for both the one who gives it and the one who takes it, because the person had no particular right that required bribery to attain
It is permissible for the giver since 50 jobs were available and he did not take anyone's specific place
It is permissible since the person was escaping from pressure and managerial difficulties
It is permissible because all other applicants who got jobs were affluent people

quizQuestions.explanation: Since the job was based on a test for applicants, bribery is haram in this case because the person was no better than anyone else and had no particular right which required paying a bribe to attain. The Messenger of Allah cursed both the one who offers a bribe and the one who takes it. However, if someone has repented and is qualified for the job, they may remain in the post.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on bringing textbooks that contain pictures into the mosque to teach students?

options.text: Not permissible unless the faces and all distinguishing features are erased, whether on the cover or inside
Permissible if the books are for educational purposes and exams are approaching
Permissible as long as the pictures are not of prophets or religious figures
Permissible if the teacher and students agree that the pictures are only for illustration

quizQuestions.explanation: It is not permissible to bring books containing pictures into the mosque unless the faces and all distinguishing features are erased, whether the picture is on the cover or inside the book. This is a clear ruling with no exceptions mentioned for educational purposes.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a few drops of blood that appear after a woman has become completely pure from nifaas (post-partum bleeding)?

options.text: They are not regarded as nifaas and do not prevent her from praying, fasting, or intimacy with her husband
They are considered part of nifaas and she must stop praying and fasting until they cease completely
They require a new ghusl before each prayer but do not invalidate the fast
They are considered menstrual blood and follow the rulings of regular menses

quizQuestions.explanation: If a woman becomes pure after nifaas (by seeing complete cessation of bleeding or the white discharge), any few drops of blood that appear afterward are not regarded as nifaas. They do not prevent her from praying, fasting, or being intimate with her husband, as stated by the Permanent Committee and Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the Islamic Fiqh Council, what forms of receiving payment are considered equivalent to hand-to-hand exchange in currency transactions?

options.text: Receiving a cheque, bank transfer, and depositing money in the seller's account
Written promissory notes, verbal agreements witnessed by two people, and gold collateral
Installment payment plans over three months, credit card transactions, and personal guarantees
Deferred payment receipts, post-dated checks, and future delivery contracts

quizQuestions.explanation: The Islamic Fiqh Council reached consensus that receipt of a cheque takes the place of receipt of money when conditions are met, and recording in bank records comes under the same ruling as receiving money. The Permanent Committee also stated that receiving a cheque or bank transfer note comes under the same ruling as receiving money on the spot.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith about invalidating wudu, what is required for wudu to be considered invalidated?

options.text: You must hear a sound or smell an odor - mere doubts or feelings do not invalidate wudu
Any strong feeling or doubt that something came out requires checking and renewing wudu
Feeling coolness at the tip of the penis or back passage requires immediate verification
You must check after every prayer to ensure nothing has come out during or after wudu

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet said: 'You should not stop (the prayer), unless you hear a sound or smell something (an odor).' This establishes the principle that wudu is not invalidated by mere doubts or feelings. Things remain as they are unless there is certainty they have changed. Even if doubt is strong or one thinks it most likely, wudu remains valid without certainty.

quizQuestions.questionText: When is it permissible for a woman to go to the public baths (hammam) according to Islamic rulings?

options.text: Only in cases of necessity when she cannot bathe at home, such as when sick, bleeding after childbirth, or unable to do ghusl elsewhere, and she must keep herself covered
During Ramadan when the home bathroom is small and she is pregnant and fears illness from the cold
Whenever her husband gives permission and she maintains proper Islamic dress
When she needs to perform ghusl after menses and prefers the facilities of public baths

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, his wife should not enter the public baths.' However, scholars granted a concession allowing women to go to public baths in cases of necessity - such as being sick, bleeding after childbirth, or having to do ghusl with no alternative - as long as they lower their gaze, guard their chastity, and cover their awrahs. Simply having a small bathroom at home does not constitute necessity if she can heat water and bathe there.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the minimum number of wipes required when performing istijmaar (cleaning with stones or tissue)?

options.text: No less than three wipes
No less than five wipes to make it an odd number
No less than seven wipes as prescribed
Twenty-one times as mentioned in the hadith

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade cleaning ourselves with less than three stones, as narrated by Muslim. Both purification and completing three are stipulated together according to scholars like al-Shafi'i. If purity is not achieved after three, more wipes are needed, and it's best to make it an odd number.
tags: Cleaning oneself after defecating or urinating

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the correct view regarding zakat on honey according to the majority of scholars?

options.text: No zakat is due on honey itself, but zakat is due on its value if prepared for sale and one year has passed
One-tenth of honey must be paid as zakat according to authentic hadiths
Zakat on honey is obligatory as practiced by Umar ibn al-Khattab
One-quarter of one-tenth is due on honey directly from the hives

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the Standing Committee and the majority of scholars including Malik and al-Shafi'i, no zakat is due on honey itself. The hadiths about zakat on honey are considered weak. However, zakat is due on its value if it is prepared for sale and one year has passed, at a rate of one-quarter of one-tenth. The one-tenth that Umar took was interpreted as payment for protection, not zakat.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on working in a factory that manufactures pet food containing pork?

options.text: It is not permissible because it involves helping in sin by manufacturing pork products for sale
It is permissible since the pork is being used to feed animals, not humans
It is permissible as long as one does not directly handle the pork
It is permissible if the worker needs the income and has no other job options

quizQuestions.explanation: While it is permissible to feed dead meat including pork to animals like dogs and cats, it is not permissible to sell pork or work in such a factory. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said that Allah and His Messenger have forbidden the sale of pork. Working in this factory is helping in sin and haraam things, as the product is manufactured with the aim of selling it. Allah says: 'Help you one another in virtue and righteousness, but do not help one another in sin and transgression.'

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, why is Quran recited out loud in the nighttime prayers but silently in daytime prayers?

options.text: Night is a time when voices are stilled and hearts are more focused, making the heart, tongue, and ears all involved in recitation
The day is when people gather in mosques, so silent recitation prevents disturbance to others
Loud recitation at night helps wake people up for prayer, while day prayers need no such reminder
The Prophet (peace be upon him) had a stronger voice at night than during the day

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars explained that night is a time when people are quiet and alone, with hearts more focused and renewed energy. Allah says the rising by night is 'most suitable for understanding the Word of Allah.' The heart, sight, hearing, and tongue work together in harmony when reciting Quran at night because voices and movements are stilled. In contrast, the day is a time of distractions and mixing with people, when the mind cannot focus fully on conversing with Allah.

quizQuestions.questionText: A man told his menstruating wife 'Consider yourself divorced after your period ends' but did not actually divorce her when her period ended. What is the ruling?

options.text: The divorce does not count because his intention was to do it in the future, then he did not do it
The divorce counts automatically once her period ended, even though he did not pronounce it again
The divorce is suspended and becomes valid if he does not take her back within three days
The divorce counts from the moment he made the statement, regardless of when the period ended

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Dr. Khalid al-Mushayqih, the divorce does not count in this case because the man's intention was to do it in the future, then he did not do it. The statement was conditional on a future action that he never performed, so the divorce is not effective.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the 'best prayer for seeking forgiveness' (Sayyid al-Istighfar) according to the Prophet (peace be upon him)?

options.text: Allahumma anta rabbi la ilaha illa anta, Khalaqtani wa ana abduka - O Allah, You are my Lord, none has the right to be worshipped but You, You created me and I am Your slave
Rabbighfir warham wa anta khayrur-rahimin - My Lord! Forgive and show mercy, for You are the Best of those who show mercy
Rabighfir li wa tubb alayya innaka antat-tawwab ul-ghafur - My Lord, forgive me and accept my repentance
Rabbana ighfir lana dhunubana wa israfana fi amrina - Our Lord! Forgive us our sins and transgressions

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaddad ibn Aws reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said the best prayer for seeking forgiveness is the full du'a beginning with 'Allahumma anta rabbi la ilaha illa anta, Khalaqtani wa ana abduka...' which acknowledges Allah as Lord, seeks refuge from evil done, acknowledges blessings, confesses sins, and asks forgiveness. The Prophet said whoever says this during the day with faith and dies before evening will be among the people of Paradise. Narrated by Al-Bukhari.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman uncovering in front of the son of her husband's daughter?

options.text: He is regarded as a mahram for her because she is the wife of his grandfather, so she may uncover in front of him
He is not a mahram unless her husband (his grandfather) is still alive
He becomes a mahram only when he reaches adulthood at age eighteen
He is not a mahram because the relationship is through her husband's daughter, not direct lineage

quizQuestions.explanation: The son is regarded as a mahram for this woman, so she may shake hands with him and uncover in front of him as she uncovers in front of her mahrams. It makes no difference that his grandfather is deceased. He is her mahram because she is the wife of his grandfather on his mother's side. Permanently forbidden in marriage for a man are his father's and his grandfather's wife, no matter how far the line of ascent reaches. There is no dispute concerning this among the scholars.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on using a credit card that charges a fixed penalty fee for late payment?

options.text: It is not permissible to use because stipulating a penalty for late payment is riba, whether it is a percentage or fixed amount
It is permissible if the user is determined to pay on time before the deadline
It is permissible because a fixed fee is different from a percentage-based interest charge
It is permissible as long as the penalty is reasonable, such as 150 riyals per statement

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the Islamic Fiqh Council, it is not permissible to issue or use an 'unloaded' credit card if it is stipulated that interest be paid, even if the one requesting the card is determined to pay it off within the grace period. It makes no difference whether the penalty is a percentage or a fixed amount - anything stipulated in addition to the debt is riba.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say when he saw Sa'd being extravagant with water during wudoo?

options.text: What is this extravagance? There can be extravagance in wudoo even if you are on the bank of a flowing river
Use water moderately, for water is a blessing from Allah that should not be wasted
Do not use more than one container of water for wudoo, even near a river
Make your wudoo with only three handfuls of water, following the Sunnah

quizQuestions.explanation: Imam Ahmad and Ibn Maajah narrated from Abdullah ibn Amr ibn al-'Aas that the Prophet (peace be upon him) passed by Sa'd when he was doing wudoo and said, 'What is this extravagance, O Sa'd?' When Sa'd asked if there could be extravagance in wudoo, the Prophet confirmed, 'Yes, even if you are on the bank of a flowing river.' This shows that wasting water is forbidden even when water is abundant.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on Muslim women shaving or removing hair from their legs?

options.text: It is permitted, and a woman may remove all her body hair such as on arms or legs if it will increase her beauty
It is forbidden because legs are not mentioned in the hadith about things consistent with fitrah
It is forbidden as an imitation of the unbelievers who introduced this practice
It is permissible only if done to please her husband, otherwise it is makrooh

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Islamic schools of thought mentioned in Al-Mawsu'ah al-Fiqhiyyah, a woman may remove all her body hair such as that on the arms or legs if removing it will increase her beauty. However, she must leave whatever makes her beautiful, so she is forbidden to shave the hair on her head or pluck her eyebrows.
tags: Natural character and instinct of the human creation

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the Quran (Al-A'raaf 7:188), what did Allah instruct the Prophet to say about knowledge of the unseen (Ghayb)?

options.text: If he had knowledge of the unseen, he would have secured for himself an abundance of wealth, and no evil should have touched him
If he had knowledge of the unseen, he would have avoided all trials and could have guided people perfectly
If he had knowledge of the unseen, he would have known the exact time of the Last Day
If he had knowledge of the unseen, he would have known which companions would remain faithful

quizQuestions.explanation: The verse Al-A'raaf 7:188 states that the Prophet should say: 'If I had the knowledge of the Ghayb (Unseen), I should have secured for myself an abundance of wealth, and no evil should have touched me.' This demonstrates that even the Prophet had no knowledge of the unseen, which belongs only to Allah.
tags: Belief in the Divine Will and Decree

quizQuestions.questionText: Is it required to mention the name of the child over the aqeeqah animal when slaughtering it?

options.text: No, mentioning the name is not stipulated; what matters is the intention that it be an aqeeqah
Yes, the child's name must be mentioned three times during slaughter
Yes, but only if the father is the one slaughtering the animal
It is recommended but not required for the aqeeqah to be valid

quizQuestions.explanation: In order for the aqeeqah to be valid, it is not stipulated that the name of the child be mentioned over it. What matters is that the one who offers it intends that it be an aqeeqah. The slaughterman or butcher does not even need to be aware that it is an aqeeqah.
tags: Aqeeqah and rulings on the new-born

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman completing her diploma studies after stopping work at the university that nominated her while employed?

options.text: There is nothing wrong if her name appeared on the updated list, as the university appears aware and has agreed, though checking with the department is safer
She must stop immediately as continuing without employment is considered deception
She can continue only if she pays the tuition fees for the current year
She must wait until she resumes employment before continuing her studies

quizQuestions.explanation: If she was nominated while working and her name still appears on the updated list despite stopping work, there is nothing wrong with completing the studies, as the university appears aware and has agreed. However, checking with the relevant department would be better and safer.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is one of the conditions for being accountable (mukallaf) in Islam according to the hadith mentioned?

options.text: Being of sound mind, as the Pen has been lifted from the insane person until he comes to his senses
Being physically strong enough to perform all acts of worship
Having completed memorization of at least part of the Quran
Being free from all chronic illnesses and disabilities

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith states 'The Pen has been lifted from three: from the sleeping person until he wakes up, from the minor until he grows up, and from the insane person until he comes to his senses.' Being of sound mind is a fundamental condition for accountability.

quizQuestions.questionText: What was the response to the girl who was being taught by a man who claimed to be teaching and reforming through chat and messenger?

options.text: She should cut off all contact with this man immediately and make use of books and educational websites instead
She should continue learning but only through email with formal language
She should involve a third party mahram to monitor the conversations
She should report the matter to Islamic authorities for investigation

quizQuestions.explanation: The clear instruction was to cut off all contact with this man immediately, and make use of books and educational websites. She was also reminded to ensure not to become a means of misguiding someone who appears religious.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a husband being absent from his wife for more than six months when he is a student abroad?

options.text: If the wife accepts the husband being away for this length of time, then there is nothing wrong with it
It is absolutely forbidden regardless of the wife's consent or circumstances
He must obtain written permission from the local Islamic court before traveling
He can stay away but must send a representative to visit the wife monthly

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa clearly states that if the wife accepts the husband being away for this length of time, then there is nothing wrong with it. The wife's consent is the key factor in this situation.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Shaykh Ibn Uthaymeen say about using food items like eggs, honey and milk for treating skin conditions?

options.text: There is nothing wrong if a person needs them for remedy, as Allah created all things on earth for beneficial uses, though other materials are better for beautification
It is absolutely forbidden as food should only be used for nourishment
It is permissible only for medical treatment but completely forbidden for beautification purposes
It is allowed only if one has excess food beyond their family's needs

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Uthaymeen explained that these foods were created by Allah to nourish the body, but if a person needs to use them for remedy, there is nothing wrong as Allah says 'He created for you all that is on earth.' However, for beautification, it is better to use other materials.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on buying and wearing T-shirts with the word "Allah" written on them?

options.text: It is not permissible because they involve disrespect towards Allah's name when thrown in bathrooms or other inappropriate places
It is permissible as long as the shirt is washed separately from other clothes
It is permissible if the wearer removes the shirt before entering the bathroom
It is recommended as a form of public declaration of faith

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa states it is not permissible to buy or wear these T-shirts because they involve disrespect towards the name of Allah, which is bound to be mistreated when shirts are thrown in bathrooms or other inappropriate places, especially when they get dirty and need washing.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Ibn as-Salaah, what is the status of hadiths narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim that were accepted by the ummah?

options.text: They are definitively sound and we should be certain about them, because the ummah is protected from error in its consensus
They are probably sound but cannot reach the level of certainty like mutawatir hadiths
They require individual verification through additional chains of narration
They are sound only if both al-Bukhari and Muslim narrated them, not if only one did

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn as-Salaah held that the hadiths of as-Saheehayn are definitively sound and we should be certain about them, because the ummah is unanimously agreed on their soundness, and the ummah is protected from error in its consensus (apart from a few critiqued hadiths).

quizQuestions.questionText: Who was Dhu'th-Thudayyah and what was his role?

options.text: He was Hurqoos ibn Zuhayr al-Bajali, one of the Khawaarij who rebelled against Ali and was the last of them, serving as their sign
He was a companion of the Prophet who fought alongside Ali at the battle of Badr
He was the leader of the Khawaarij who first confronted the Prophet about fairness
He was a scholar from Basra who documented the history of the Khawaarij movement

quizQuestions.explanation: Dhu'th-Thudayyah's full name was Hurqoos ibn Zuhayr al-Bajali. He was one of the Khawaarij who rebelled against Ali. The first of the Khawaarij was Dhu'l-Khuwaysirah at-Tameemi, and Dhu'th-Thudayyah was the last of them, serving as the prophesied sign of these people.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should you do if your parents insist on including forbidden things like mixing or wanton display in the wedding party?

options.text: Advise them and explain the shar'i ruling, and if they persist, keep away from the place of evil and announce your disavowal of it
Remain silent in the gathering to maintain family harmony, as the Quran says those who sit with wrongdoers share their burden
Participate in organizing the wedding but refuse to use the duff, as this instrument differentiates halal from haram marriages
Cancel the waleemah entirely, since the hadith states marriage that begins with sin is unlikely to be blessed

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'If they persist in their view, then keep away from the place of evil and announce your dislike and disavowal of it.' The Quran (4:140) indicates it is obligatory to avoid people who commit sin openly. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Whoever among you sees an evil action, let him change it with his hand; if he cannot, then with his tongue; and if he cannot, then with his heart.'

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith from Asma' bint Yazeed, in which three specific cases are lies not considered inappropriate?

options.text: When a man speaks to his wife to please her, telling lies at times of war, and lying to bring about reconciliation between people
When giving charity secretly to increase parents' good deeds, when protecting someone's trust, and when concealing a Muslim's faults
When intermediating between disputing parties, when testifying in court to protect the innocent, and when hiding wealth from oppressors
When speaking about buying items for charity, when promising to repay a debt, and when conveying good news to relatives

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith narrated from Asma' bint Yazeed states: 'Lies are not appropriate except in three cases: when a man speaks to his wife to please her, telling lies at times of war, and lying in order to bring about reconciliation between people.' The answer clarifies that telling lies to family about spending is not an excuse.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the majority of scholars, what is the ruling if a husband is unable to spend on his wife?

options.text: It is sufficient grounds for separating them if the wife requests it, but if she accepts it and does not ask for separation, no one has the right to separate them
The wife's family must take her away by force and stipulate that he become very rich before returning her to him
Guardianship of the wife automatically passes to her father's family until the husband can provide adequate financial support
The courts must immediately separate them regardless of the wife's wishes, as spending on the wife is one of the conditions of a valid marriage

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'The majority of scholars are of the view that the husband's inability to spend on his wife is sufficient grounds for separating them, if the wife requests that. But if she accepts it and does not ask for separation, then no one has the right to separate them.' The wife's family taking her away is described as wrongdoing.

quizQuestions.questionText: When does zakah become obligatory on inherited wealth according to the Standing Committee's ruling?

options.text: When each heir has taken possession of his share and can dispose of it, if it reaches the nisaab when one full year has passed
Immediately after the death of the deceased, calculated on all the heirs' shares put together at the rate of one quarter of one tenth
Two years after the death regardless of whether the estate has been divided, as this is the maximum delay permitted for estate division
As soon as the banks decide about division of the estate, even if the heirs live abroad and have not yet appointed court representatives

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'If you do become able to take possession of it or dispose of it, then you must pay zakah on it from the time when you become able to dispose of it, if it reaches the minimum threshold, when one full year has passed.' The Standing Committee ruled that no zakah is due during the period when the estate was not divided because ownership was not established.

quizQuestions.questionText: In the story of Haroon al-Rasheed and the heretic who fabricated hadiths, how did the Caliph respond to the heretic's claim about fabricating thousands of hadiths?

options.text: He said: 'What will you do, O enemy of Allah, about Abu Ishaaq al-Fazaari and Abdullah ibn al-Mubaarak? They will go through them and sift them letter by letter'
He immediately ordered all hadith collections to be reviewed and commanded that the Muslim lands be searched for other fabricators
He pardoned the heretic on condition that he publicly reveal which hadiths he fabricated so they could be removed from circulation
He expressed concern that these fabrications had already deceived the muhadditheen, as European critics and some Muslims claimed

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer narrates: 'Haroon al-Rasheed said to him: "What will you do, O enemy of Allah, about Abu Ishaaq al-Fazaari and Abdullah ibn al-Mubaarak? They will go through them and sift them letter by letter."' This demonstrates the confidence in the scholars' ability to detect fabrications. Muhammad Asad confirmed that 'fabricated hadiths never deceived the muhadditheen.'
tags: Sources for Islamic Rulings and Shariah

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on using cream or ointment for hemorrhoids during Ramadan according to the Standing Committee?

options.text: Using cream or ointment for hemorrhoids does not affect the fast, whether applied inside or outside
It breaks the fast and requires making up the day, as it enters the body through an opening and delivers medication
External application is permitted, but internal application breaks the fast and requires both making up the day and expiation
It is permitted only in cases of extreme necessity when the pain becomes unbearable, and the day must still be made up later

quizQuestions.explanation: The Standing Committee's fatwa, signed by Shaykh Ibn Baz, Shaykh Aal al-Shaykh, Shaykh Ibn Ghadyaan, Shaykh al-Fawzaan, and Shaykh Bakr Abu Zayd, clearly states: 'Using cream or ointment for haemorrhoids does not affect the fast.' The question mentioned both inside and outside application.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (ﷺ) command Ali to do when his father Abu Talib died as a mushrik, and what was forbidden afterward?

options.text: The Prophet commanded him to bury his father, but it is not prescribed to wash, shroud, offer funeral prayer over him, or make dua for him after burial
The Prophet told him to perform the complete funeral rites including washing and shrouding, but to make dua that Allah lighten his punishment in Hell
The Prophet instructed him to arrange the burial but delegate it to other relatives, then follow the funeral procession to show family compassion
The Prophet permitted him to wash and shroud the body as the last act of good companionship, but forbade offering the funeral prayer

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Go and bury your father"' but clarifies 'It is not prescribed for him to wash or shroud a kaafir, or to offer the funeral prayer over him, even if he was a relative, because the Prophet (ﷺ) did not tell Ali to do that.' After burial, he cannot make dua or pray for forgiveness (Quran 9:113).

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith, when does the ruler (judge) become the wali for a woman who has no wali?

options.text: When there is a dispute - specifically when the wali refuses to marry her to a compatible man with whom she is pleased
Automatically after she completes university studies and becomes financially independent from her family
When her father is Muslim but has wrong thoughts about Islam regarding issues like hijab and mixing
Whenever the woman leaves her family home and plans for marriage within two months, even without consulting her guardian

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith states: 'if there is any dispute, then the ruler is the wali of the one who has no wali.' The answer explains that 'if the wali refuses to marry the female relative under his care to a compatible man with whom she is pleased, then he is preventing her from getting married and guardianship passes' - ultimately to the judge if needed.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the scholarly consensus regarding swearing oaths by the attributes of Allah such as His glory, knowledge, or power?

options.text: It is permissible to swear by Allah's attributes, and the ruling is the same as swearing by His names - this is affirmed by scholars of all four madhhabs
It is impermissible according to the stronger view, as the hadith limits permissible oaths to saying 'by Allah' using this specific name only
It is permitted only when swearing by the attribute of life or knowledge, but swearing by glory, power, or hearing is discouraged
The Hanafi and Shafi'i schools permit it with expiation required if broken, while Hanbali and Maliki schools consider it makruh

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'There should be no dispute, because these are oaths like the first kind' and 'This is what has also been stated by the fuqaha' of the four madhhabs.' Ibn Taymiyah said: 'swearing by His attributes is like swearing by Him.' The text provides evidence from Bukhari, Muslim, and all four schools of jurisprudence.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on having intercourse on the first night of marriage?

options.text: It is not obligatory, not having intercourse is not a sin, and it does not prevent celebrating the waleemah - what happens is the couple's concern alone
It is obligatory according to the majority of scholars, and failure to consummate constitutes a sin that delays the waleemah celebration
It is strongly recommended within the first three nights, and delaying beyond this without valid excuse prevents the marriage from being announced
It is required to differentiate the halal relationship from haram ones, similar to how beating the daff announces the marriage publicly

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states: 'What you have heard - that it is obligatory to have intercourse on the first night of marriage - is not correct at all. Not having intercourse on that night is not a sin, and does not prevent one from celebrating the waleemah.' It emphasizes that 'whatever happens between the two partners on their wedding night is their concern alone.'

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh al-Albaani in Da'eef al-Jaami', what is the status of the hadith "Whoever taunts his brother with a sin will not die until he commits the same sin"?

options.text: Saheeh (authentic)
Hasan (good)
Da'eef (weak)
Mawdoo' (fabricated)

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh al-Albaani described this hadith in Da'eef al-Jaami' (5710) as mawdoo' (fabricated). If a hadith is da'eef and mawdoo', it cannot be taken as a basis for rulings or be acted upon.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith about the disputed child between Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqaas and 'Abd ibn Zam'ah, what principle did the Prophet (peace be upon him) establish?

options.text: The child belongs to whoever has the stronger physical resemblance
"The child is for the (owner of the) bed" - attributed to the marital bed
The child belongs to whoever the mother names as the father
The child should be named after both claimants equally

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "He is yours, O 'Abd ibn Zam'ah. The child is for the (owner of the) bed." This means the child is attributed to the husband, even if there is clear resemblance to another man, unless the husband engages in li'aan to deny paternity.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say will happen to a man who has two wives and favours one over the other?

options.text: He will be prohibited from Paradise for forty years
He will come on the Day of Resurrection with one of his sides leaning
He will be required to divorce the less-favoured wife
He will lose half of his accumulated good deeds

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever has two wives and favours one of them over the other, will come on the Day of Resurrection with one of his sides leaning." This hadith was narrated by al-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawood, al-Nasaa'i and Ibn Majaah.
tags: Plural marriage and fair treatment of co-wives

quizQuestions.questionText: If a sacrifice animal gets injured after being selected for sacrifice but before slaughter (without the owner's negligence), what is the ruling according to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen?

options.text: It must be replaced with a completely sound animal
It may still be slaughtered and this will suffice
The owner must sacrifice two animals instead of one
The owner must give the injured animal in charity and buy a new one

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen explained that when the animal was selected, it became a trust. Since the injury was not the result of the owner's action or negligence, he is not obliged to offer any guarantee, and slaughtering it will suffice.

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the two main reasons mentioned for the weakness (da'eef status) of the hadith from Salmaan al-Faarisi about the virtues of Ramadan?

options.text: The hadith contradicts the Quran and contains fabricated narrators
There is a break in the chain (Sa'eed ibn al-Musayyib did not hear from Salmaan) and its isnaad includes 'Ali ibn Zayd ibn Jad'aan who is weak
It was narrated by only one person and contains unknown narrators
The meaning contradicts other authentic hadiths and the chain includes known liars

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith is da'eef for two reasons: (1) There is a break in the chain of narrators because Sa'eed ibn al-Musayyib did not hear it from Salmaan al-Faarisi, and (2) Its isnaad includes 'Ali ibn Zayd ibn Jad'aan, who was classed as da'eef by Ahmad, Ibn Ma'een, al-Nasaa'i, Ibn Khuzaymah and others.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the majority of Hanafi, Shafa'i and Hanbali scholars, what is the ruling if worms come out of the back passage?

options.text: It does not invalidate wudu but requires ghusl
It invalidates wudu
It only invalidates wudu if accompanied by wind
It requires only istinja' (cleaning) without needing to renew wudu

quizQuestions.explanation: The majority of Hanafi, Shafa'i and Hanbali scholars hold that worms coming out of the back passage invalidate wudu, because whatever comes out of the front and back passages - whether ordinary or rare - breaks wudu. This includes rare things like worms, stones, and hair.
tags: Cleaning oneself after defecating or urinating

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the expiation options for a person who must cover his head while in ihram due to medical necessity (such as severe sensitivity to sunlight)?

options.text: Only sacrificing a camel and distributing it in Makkah
Sacrificing a sheep for the poor in Makkah, OR feeding six poor persons (half a saa' each), OR fasting three days
Paying monetary compensation equal to 100 Saudi riyals
Performing an additional 'Umrah the following year

quizQuestions.explanation: A person who must cover his head in ihram due to medical necessity may do so, and must expiate by one of three options: (1) sacrificing a sheep and giving it to the poor in Makkah, OR (2) feeding six poor persons, giving each one half a saa' of dates or other staple food, OR (3) fasting for three days. A separate expiation is required for 'Umrah if entering ihram for it.
tags: Things which are not allowed in Ihraam

quizQuestions.questionText: If a woman has a miscarriage before eighty-one days of pregnancy, how is the bleeding that follows classified?

options.text: It is always nifaas (post-partum bleeding) requiring her to stop praying
It is istihaadah (non-menstrual bleeding) unless it coincides with her usual period time, in which case it is menstrual bleeding
It is neither nifaas nor menses, and she must pray immediately without waiting
It is nifaas for the first seven days only, then becomes istihaadah

quizQuestions.explanation: If a woman has a miscarriage before eighty-one days of pregnancy, the bleeding is not regarded as nifaas; rather it is istihaadah (non-menstrual vaginal bleeding), unless it coincides with the usual time of her period, in which case it is menstrual bleeding. Istihaadah does not prevent praying, fasting and tawaaf.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith narrated by Muslim, what is forgiven for the one who does ghusl, comes to Jumu'ah, prays what is decreed, listens attentively until the khutbah ends, and prays with the imam?

options.text: All sins committed in his entire lifetime
Sins between that Jumu'ah and the next Jumu'ah, and three days more
Only minor sins from the previous week
Only sins committed on Friday specifically

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said that such a person "will be forgiven (his sins) between that and the next Jumu'ah, and three days more." This was narrated by Muslim (857), showing the immense virtue of properly attending and listening to the Friday khutbah.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, when is an agent (wakeel) liable for the loss or destruction of property in his care?

options.text: He is always liable regardless of the circumstances
He is liable only in the case of deliberate transgression or negligence
He is liable only if he was being paid for his services as an agent
He is never liable as long as he is a trustworthy Muslim

quizQuestions.explanation: The guideline, as the scholars stated, is that an honest person (trustee) is not liable unless he transgresses or is negligent. Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen confirmed that no trustee is liable except in the case of deliberate transgression or negligence. If the loss happened without negligence, the agent is not liable.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith mentioned, which three types of du'aa' will undoubtedly be answered?

options.text: The du'aa' of one who has been wronged, the du'aa' of the traveller, and the du'aa' of a father for his child
The du'aa' of a pregnant woman, the du'aa' of the traveller, and the du'aa' of one who has been wronged
The du'aa' of a mother during pregnancy, the du'aa' of a father for his child, and the du'aa' after tahajjud
The du'aa' of parents for their children, the du'aa' of the traveller, and the du'aa' during prostration

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'There are three du'aa's that will undoubtedly be answered: the du'aa' of one who has been wronged, the du'aa' of the traveller and the du'aa' of a father for his child.' Al-Mannaawi noted that the mother is not mentioned explicitly because it is well known that her du'aa' is even more likely to be answered than the father's, due to her genuine compassion.

quizQuestions.questionText: If a woman's husband dies during her 'iddah from a final (third) divorce, what 'iddah must she complete?

options.text: She should complete the 'iddah of divorce only, because the marital relationship ended with the final talaaq
She must observe both the 'iddah of divorce and the 'iddah of one who has been widowed
She should observe the 'iddah of one who has been widowed only, as death supersedes divorce
She should observe whichever 'iddah period is longer between divorce and widowhood

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Muhammad ibn Saalih al-'Uthaymeen ruled that she should complete the 'iddah of divorce only. She does not have to observe the 'iddah of one who has been widowed, because the marital relationship ended with the final talaaq (third divorce).
tags: Waiting Period of Widow or Divorcee

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith, what are the characteristics of a woman's maniy?

options.text: Thin and yellow in color
Thick and white in color
Clear discharge from the uterus
White and thin fluid

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'The water of the man is thick and white, and the water of the woman is thin and yellow.' (Narrated by Muslim, 311). The answer notes it may be white for some women, and it smells like pollen, with pleasure felt when emitted and desire ceasing immediately after.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Hanafi scholars, what must a recently-widowed woman avoid during mourning ('iddah)?

options.text: Perfume, kohl, skin cream, henna, clothes dyed with safflower and saffron, jewellery, and dyeing hair
Only remarrying during the 'iddah period of four months and ten days
Going out of the house at any time, day or night, except for extreme emergencies
Speaking to non-mahram men and wearing any colored clothing including black

quizQuestions.explanation: As-Samarqandi stated that mourning means avoiding everything that women adorn themselves with, such as putting on perfume, wearing clothing dyed with safflower or saffron, putting kohl on eyes, using skin creams, combing hair, wearing jewellery, and dyeing hair. The claim that she only has to refrain from remarrying is incorrect according to all four madhhabs.
tags: Waiting Period of Widow or Divorcee

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a woman do if the nifas (post-partum bleeding) stops after 20 days?

options.text: She should do ghusl and pray and fast, and she is permissible for her husband
She must wait until 40 days have passed before resuming prayer and fasting
She can pray and fast but must wait 40 days before her husband can have intercourse with her
She should do ghusl but wait until completing 40 days of purification before fasting

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Baz stated: 'If she becomes pure after twenty days, she should do ghusl and pray and fast, and she is permissible for her husband.' The majority of scholars agree there is no minimum limit for nifas, and whenever a woman becomes pure she must resume her obligations.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) name his animals?

options.text: He had a she-camel called al-'Adba', a horse called al-Laheef, and a donkey called 'Ufayr
He had a horse called al-Mandoob, a camel called Damoon, and a sheep called al-Jaraadah
He had a she-camel called al-Mandoob, a horse called al-'Adba', and a donkey called al-Laheef
He only named his horse al-'Adba' and did not give names to other animals

quizQuestions.explanation: According to authentic hadith in Bukhari, the Prophet (peace be upon him) had a she-camel called al-'Adba', a horse called al-Laheef, and a donkey called 'Ufayr. Al-Mandoob was a horse belonging to Abu Talhah, and al-Jaraadah was Abu Qataadah's horse.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should someone do if they took items from work and later repented, but cannot remember which specific office the items came from?

options.text: Return the items or equivalent to the department itself, without needing to disclose what was done
They must confess to the department manager and identify the exact office or their repentance is invalid
Give double the value in charity to compensate for not knowing the specific office
The repentance is accepted and no action is needed since they forgot where the items came from

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'You should try to find the office from which you took them; if you cannot do that, then it is sufficient – in sha Allah – for you to return them to the department itself.' It also notes that one does not have to disclose what was done; it's sufficient to return the items or equivalent.

quizQuestions.questionText: At what point in pregnancy do human features first appear on the foetus, determining whether bleeding is nifaas or irregular bleeding?

options.text: The earliest that human features appear is eighty-one days of pregnancy
Human features appear at sixty days (two months) of pregnancy
Human features can appear as early as forty days of pregnancy
Human features appear at one hundred and twenty days when the soul is breathed in

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states: 'The earliest that the human features appear is eighty-one days (of pregnancy).' Before this point, if a miscarriage occurs, the bleeding is irregular vaginal bleeding, not nifaas. Since the foetus in the question was two months old, the bleeding was irregular bleeding and the woman's fasting was valid.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on turning over an upside-down shoe according to the scholars?

options.text: There is no basis in sharee'ah for it, though it may be turned over simply because the sole is usually dirty and it's off-putting to leave it uppermost
It is obligatory to turn it over because leaving the sole facing the sky is disrespectful to Allah
The angels will not enter a house where shoes are left upside down, so it must be corrected
Ibn 'Aqeel and Ibn 'Uthaymeen both ruled it is recommended (mustahabb) to turn shoes right-side up

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated: 'That is not correct and I do not know of there being anything wrong with a shoe being upside down...there is no basis for it.' The Standing Committee noted that leaving it upside down is 'off-putting and disliked' only because the sole is usually dirty, not for any religious reason.

quizQuestions.questionText: Is a Muslim woman required to wear hijab in front of her mother's non-Muslim husband?

options.text: It is not obligatory because no report to that effect has been narrated, so the principle that all things are permitted except those expressly forbidden applies
Yes, because he is not a Muslim and therefore cannot be considered a mahram in any way
She must wear hijab unless her mother and her mother's husband both convert to Islam
She must wear hijab because they married after she moved out and have no children together

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'It is not obligatory because no report to that effect has been narrated, so we refer to the principle that all things are permitted except those which have been expressly forbidden.' However, for the purpose of being a mahram for travelling, one condition is that he should be a Muslim.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why did the police in Philadelphia first call the day after Thanksgiving 'Black Friday' in 1960?

options.text: Because of huge traffic jams, crowds and long lines in front of stores on this shopping day
Because it was connected to the financial crisis of 1869 in the United States
Because black ink was used to record profits in American ledgers on that day
Because it marked the beginning of the Christmas shopping season

quizQuestions.explanation: The police department in Philadelphia dubbed this day Black Friday in 1960 to describe the crowded chaos and traffic, both pedestrians and cars. While other explanations exist about black ink and profits, the police naming was specifically about the traffic and crowds.
tags: Alliance and Amity, Disavowal and Enmity

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the fatwa, what forms of intimacy are permitted for a husband with his wife?

options.text: Any way that Allah has permitted, including masturbation by her hand
Only traditional intercourse is permitted in such situations
He must seek medical treatment before considering alternative intimacy
He should fast frequently instead of seeking physical intimacy

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholar stated that a husband is permitted to enjoy his wife in any of the ways which Allah has permitted, and this includes masturbation by her hand.

quizQuestions.questionText: What must a Muslim do regarding money taken from Australian companies if the country deports him?

options.text: Return the money to them, as treachery and betrayal are forbidden whether with Muslims or non-Muslims
Keep the money as compensation for being rejected after paying fees for four years
Pay them back only if they allow him to visit the country again in the future
Donate the money to charity since it came from a non-Muslim country

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa clearly states that treachery and betrayal are forbidden in Islam whether with a Muslim or a kaafir. The Muslim must return the money because the country granted him safety and protection, and he must be honest and not betray them.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say about the maternal aunt's status?

options.text: The maternal aunt is of the same status as the mother
The maternal aunt should be honored like one's sister
The maternal aunt has rights similar to other relatives
Treating the maternal aunt kindly is recommended but not emphasized

quizQuestions.explanation: Abu Dawud (2278) narrated from Ali that the Messenger of Allah said: 'The maternal aunt is of the same status as the mother.' This high status applies to custody, showing kindness, honoring, and upholding ties of kinship with her.

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the exceptions to the rule that all actions are allowed unless forbidden?

options.text: Sexual relationships, forms of worship, eating meat, and disposing of another's property - these are forbidden except what is expressly permitted
Business transactions, food consumption, and public behavior require specific permission
Matters of inheritance, marriage contracts, and ritual purification must follow explicit texts
Forms of charity, types of clothing, and travel arrangements need clear evidence of permissibility

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa specifies that in matters of sexual relationships, forms of worship, eating meat, and disposing of another person's property, the rule is that it is forbidden except that which is expressly permitted. It also notes that it is forbidden to dispose of another person's property except with his permission.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on praying the first two rak'ahs of Tarawih with the intention of praying the Sunnah of Isha?

options.text: It is valid, just as it is valid to pray Isha behind someone praying Tarawih
It is not valid because Tarawih and Sunnah prayers have different intentions
It is only valid if the imam gives permission beforehand
It is discouraged but acceptable in cases of extreme time constraints

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa states that yes, it is valid to pray two rak'ahs of Tarawih with the intention of the Sunnah of Isha. In fact, it is even valid to pray Isha behind someone who is praying Tarawih. Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin explained that it does not matter if the intentions of the imam and the person praying behind him are different.

quizQuestions.questionText: When is it permissible to give zakah in the form of goods instead of cash according to some scholars?

options.text: When the poor person is insane, feebleminded, foolish or immature and may mishandle cash, if goods are evaluated correctly
When the charity organization requests items instead of money for distribution efficiency
During winter months when blankets and warm clothing are more beneficial than money
When providing medical aid or food hampers through trustworthy charities

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn Baz, it is permissible to give goods instead of cash if the poor person is insane, feebleminded, foolish or immature, and there is fear that he may mess about with cash. The goods must be evaluated correctly and equal in value to the zakah amount. This is when there is a need for that or an interest to be served.

quizQuestions.questionText: What type of lying is NOT permitted between spouses according to the scholars?

options.text: Lying that leads to undermining rights or evasion of duties
Exaggerating expressions of love and affection to maintain harmony
Making promises and raising hopes to keep a good relationship
Saying nice things that are not entirely accurate to please one's spouse

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars, including An-Nawawi and Ibn Hajar, are unanimously agreed that lying with regard to spouses means lying in matters that do not lead to waiving of duties or acquiring that to which one has no right. Lying that leads to undermining rights or evasion of duties is prohibited.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Sunnah regarding the number of sheep to sacrifice for aqiqah for a male child?

options.text: Two sheep is the Sunnah, but one sheep fulfills the basic requirement and is permissible
One sheep is sufficient and there is no difference in reward
Two sheep are obligatory for boys while one is recommended for girls
The number depends on the family's financial situation, from one to three sheep

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa explains that the Sunnah is to offer two sheep on behalf of a male child, based on the hadith of Umm Karaz. However, if one sheep is slaughtered on behalf of a boy, he has fulfilled the basic requirement of the Sunnah, because the Prophet sacrificed one ram each for Al-Hasan and Al-Husayn.
tags: Aqeeqah and rulings on the new-born

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a child who has reached the age of discernment but not adolescence do for Hajj?

options.text: Put on ihram garments and do all rituals himself, with his guardian stoning the Jamarat on his behalf if he cannot
Wear regular clothes while his father performs all the rituals on his behalf
Make the intention but his father or guardian does Tawaf and Sa'i carrying him
Accompany his parents through the rituals without entering ihram since he is not yet obligated

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa states that if a child has reached the age of discernment but not adolescence, he should be told to put on ihram garments and do all the rituals of Hajj for himself, from entering ihram at the meeqat until the end. His father or guardian should stone the Jamarat on his behalf if he cannot do it himself, and he should be told to avoid what is forbidden while in ihram.
tags: Sifat al-Hajj wa'l-'Umrah (Description of Hajj and 'Umrah)

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the minimum period of purity (tuhr) required between two menstrual periods according to Islamic law?

options.text: There is no set minimum limit for the period of purity between two menstrual periods
Fifteen days must pass between periods as the minimum purity period
Seven days must pass between periods as required by Sharia
Ten days must pass between periods according to scholarly consensus

quizQuestions.explanation: There is no set minimum limit for the period of purity between two menstrual periods. Rather, when a woman sees menstrual blood which is dark red, recognizable and has a distinct odor, she should refrain from fasting and praying, on condition that the total number of days of menstrual bleeding does not exceed half of the cycle (i.e., fifteen days in the month). Yellowish and brownish discharges seen after the period has ended are of no significance.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on the claim that visiting the grave of Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) equals seventy pilgrimages to Mecca?

options.text: This is a lie and is falsely attributed to the Messenger with no basis at all
This is authentic but only applies when visiting during Ramadan
This is true specifically for visiting during Friday prayers
This is valid if done with sincere intention and proper supplications

quizQuestions.explanation: This claim has no basis at all and is a lie made up by liars. Visiting the grave of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), who is the best of all, is not equivalent to one Hajj, so how about visits to anyone else's grave? The claim that "whoever visits the members of my household (ahl bayti) after I die will have seventy Hajj recorded for him" is also false and has no basis whatsoever. These are fabrications falsely attributed to the Messenger.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on 'skin sewing' where a needle with temporary thread is passed through the dead layers of skin and removed within one or two days?

options.text: It does not come under the heading of tattooing if the thread is temporary and removed within one or two days
It is the same as permanent tattooing and is therefore forbidden in Islam
It is only allowed for medical purposes under doctor supervision
It is prohibited because it changes the creation of Allah permanently
